sections.title: Project Context & Role Clarification
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee’s involvement in Phoenix Feature Store and clarify responsibilities in feature engineering, CI/CD for ML models, and drift detection.
sample_questions: Can you outline your primary responsibilities within the Phoenix Feature Store project?
How does your MLOps role intersect with the Build phase deliverables?
What are the key success criteria you track for both online and offline feature stores?

sections.title: Feature Store Architecture & Data Flow
sections.goal: Understand the technical design, including ingestion pipelines, storage layers, serving APIs, and how they align with Novereon’s policies and values.
sample_questions: Walk me through the end-to-end data flow from raw source to model-serving in Phoenix.
How do you ensure compliance with POL-SEC-001 Least Privilege & JIT Access in your pipeline design?
What controls are in place to maintain data freshness and minimize feature staleness?

sections.title: Model CI/CD & Deployment Safety
sections.goal: Explore the approach to continuous integration and deployment for ML models, including rollback strategies and adherence to SLAs.
sample_questions: How do you integrate model CI/CD into the Phoenix Feature Store workflows?
Can you describe the RB-FS-034 Hotfix Rollback Procedure and when you last applied it?
What SLA or SLO targets influence your deployment cadence?

sections.title: Drift Monitoring & Incident Response
sections.goal: Examine drift detection mechanisms, alerting thresholds, and incident handling procedures.
sample_questions: What types of drift do you monitor, and how are they detected in production?
How do you tune alerting to avoid fatigue while still catching critical drift?
Describe a recent drift incident and how you resolved it.

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies & Integration
sections.goal: Connect Phoenix to other systems like Helios Datalake or Nimbus Observability, identifying multi-hop dependencies.
sample_questions: How does Phoenix consume data from Helios Datalake and ensure schema consistency?
What role does Nimbus Observability play in your feature store’s monitoring stack?
Can you give an example of a change upstream that required adjustments in Phoenix?

sections.title: Quality Assurance & Risk Management
sections.goal: Assess the QA practices applied to Phoenix, including risk-based testing and mitigation strategies.
sample_questions: Which elements of POL-QA-014 Risk-Based Testing are most relevant to Phoenix?
How do you test for backward compatibility in feature schemas?
What are the top three risks you see for Phoenix and how are they mitigated?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Trade-offs
sections.goal: Discuss key architectural or operational trade-offs made, supported by evidence from RFCs, runbooks, or tickets.
sample_questions: What trade-offs did you face between real-time feature freshness and cost optimization?
How did RFC-1419 Time-Travel Features influence your storage design?
Can you provide evidence from project artifacts that justified a major decision?
